### Load packages and data

library(tidyverse) 
```

nobel <- read_csv("data/nobel.csv")
```

### Exercise 2

```{r}
nobel_living <- nobel %>%
filter(is.na(died_date), (gender != "org"), (!is.na(country)))
view(nobel_living)
```

### Exercise 3

```{r}
counts <- table(nobel_living_science$country_us, nobel_living_science$category)
barplot(counts, main="Category of Prizes",
  xlab="Category", col=c("darkblue","red"),
  legend = rownames(counts), beside=TRUE,
  
)

```

### Exercise 4

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
nobel_living <- nobel_living %>%
  mutate(
    country_us = if_else(country == "USA", "USA", "Other")
  )
nobel_living_science <- nobel_living %>%
  filter(category %in% c("Physics", "Medicine", "Chemistry", "Economics"))
view(nobel_living_science)
```
Exercise 4 Continued...
```{r}
nobel_living_science %>%
mutate(born_country_us = country_us)
view(nobel_living_science)
table(nobel_living_science$born_country_us)
###Answer: 147 born in the US

```
